definitions.definition: To compose or treat in verse ; versify .
To place ( a word or words ) in such a way as to produce a rhyme or an approximation thereof.
Of a word, to be pronounced identically with another from the vowel in its stressed syllable to the end.
examples: Creation rhymes with integration and station .
India and windier rhyme with each other in non-rhotic accents.

definitions.definition: To be pronounced identically from the vowel in the stressed syllable of each to the end of each.
definitions.label_groups: reciprocal , of two or more words

definitions.definition: To contain words that are pronounced identically to each other from the vowel in the stressed syllable to the end.
examples: I rewrote the story to make it rhyme .
definitions.label_groups: intransitive , of an utterance, text, etc.

definitions.definition: To somewhat resemble or correspond with.

main_definition: ( ambitransitive ) To compose or treat in verse ; versify .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To place ( a word or words ) in such a way as to produce a rhyme or an approximation thereof.
( intransitive , followed by with ) Of a word, to be pronounced identically with another from the vowel in its stressed syllable to the end.
( reciprocal , of two or more words ) To be pronounced identically from the vowel in the stressed syllable of each to the end of each.
( intransitive , of an utterance, text, etc. ) To contain words that are pronounced identically to each other from the vowel in the stressed syllable to the end.
( intransitive , figurative , followed by with ) To somewhat resemble or correspond with.
( transitive , obsolete ) To number ; count ; reckon .
